result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Robertson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: EACH OTHER; STRAIGHT TIME; NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
- Letter of apology to Tom X.
- No Contact with Tom X.
- Maintain full-time employment/school or a combination of both.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR OUTSTANDING RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant David A Robertson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.   Court grants defense request for an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David A Robertson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for final projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David A Robertson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense just got discovery.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David A Robertson in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is Public Defender eligible.  Attorney TR Williams eformed the defendant and will be representing the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tom Xiong or his residence

Defendant David A Robertson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant David A Robertson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
